spells.name: Magic Missile
spells.target: Up to five creatures, no two of which can be more than 15 ft. apart
spells.description: A missile of magical energy springs from your pointing finger and strikes its target, dealing 1d4+1 damage. The missile always hits its intended target with no attack roll needed. You can fire one missile, plus one additional missile for every two caster levels above 1st (to a maximum of five missiles at 9th level). You can aim the missiles at the same target or different ones.

spells.name: Cure Light Wounds
spells.description: A creature touched regains 1d8+1 hit points. Since undead are powered by negative energy, this spell deals damage to them instead of curing their wounds. An undead creature can apply spell resistance, and can attempt a Will save to take half damage.

spells.name: Shield
spells.description: An invisible barrier of magical force springs into existence, granting you a +4 shield bonus to AC. Your touch AC improves by 4 as the barrier defends against touch attacks. The shield has no armor check penalty or arcane spell failure chance.

spells.name: Fireball
spells.description: A brilliant streak flashes from your pointing finger to a point of your choice within range, then blossoms with a low roar into the fireball's burst radius. Each creature in the area must make a Reflex save for half damage. The explosion creates almost no pressure.

spells.name: Lightning Bolt
spells.description: You release a powerful stroke of electrical energy that springs from your hands. The bolt begins at your fingertips. The lightning bolt travels in a straight line and deals 1d6 electricity damage per caster level (maximum 10d6) to each creature in its path.

spells.name: Cure Moderate Wounds
spells.description: A creature touched regains 2d8+1 hit points. Like cure light wounds, this spell deals damage to undead in place of curing them.

spells.name: Polymorph
spells.description: This spell transforms a creature into another form. The new form can be any creature of the same type as the subject, of the same size or one size category smaller, and that the subject is familiar with.

spells.name: Dispel Magic
spells.description: You can use dispel magic to end one or more spells on any creatures or objects within range. Choose one object, creature, or spellcaster. Attempt a dispel check against the spell or spells affecting the target.

spells.name: Haste
spells.description: The target moves, perceives, and acts faster than normal. This extra speed has several effects. A hasted creature gains a +1 bonus on attack rolls and a +1 dodge bonus to AC. Reflex saves also receive a +1 bonus. The creature gains an additional move action each round.

spells.name: Invisibility
spells.description: The creature or object touched becomes invisible. If the recipient is a creature carrying gear, that vanishes, too. If you cast the spell on someone else, neither you nor your allies can see the subject, but the subject can see itself as normal.
